data.meta_site_name: Tribute for Jack H. Adams | Steen Funeral Home
data.text:
Jack Hager Adams, 88, of Catlettsburg, died Wednesday, July 19, 2023 at the Hospice Care Center.

He was born December 5, 1934 in Ashland, the son of the late Charles A. Adams and Virginia Campbell Adams Greenwald and raised by his grandparents, Jim and Mollie Adams, Ashland, KY.

In addition to his parent’s and grandparents , two sisters, Roberta Cowey of Houston and Dorothy Adams of St Louis, also preceded him in death.

He was a retired electrician at AK Steel with 37 years of service. A United States Navy veteran serving in the Korean War aboard the USS Bremerton. Jack will be remembered as a Loving husband, father and grandfather.

Survivors include his loving wife of 67 years, Verona “Ron” Preston Adams, one son, Jerry Adams and his wife, Debbie of Catlettsburg, one sister, Maxine Adams of Houston, TX, two grandchildren, Justin Hager Adams of Nashville, TN and Kristin Nicole (Mark Rickert) Adams of Moab, UT, as well as nieces Judy Cowey Walker of Spring, TX and Jackie Levis of California, nephews Charles (Chuck) Cannon of Pasadena, TX, and James (Jim) Cannon of Houston, TX. and Paul Cowey of Houston, TX

Funeral services will be conducted at 11:00 AM Saturday, July 22, 2023 at the Rose Hill Mausoleum Chapel by Chaplain Jimm Smedley.

Burial will follow at Rose Hill Burial Park.

The family will receive friends from 6:00 PM until 8:00 PM Friday, at the STEEN FUNERAL HOME, 13th STREET CHAPEL.

Military services will be conducted by the Kenova American Legion Post 93.

The family would like to give a special thanks to his hospice nurse, Amy Johnson.

In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Community Hospice, 1480 Carter Ave. Ashland, KY 41101.

Online condolences may be made to www.steenfuneralhome.com

To send flowers to the family, please visit our floral store.
